Text.content:
The Explorer allows you a behind the scenes look on the file and folder structure that is automatically created when you use the Page editor and the Sitemap.

All resources in OpenCms are managed in a tree structure familiar to many users with general IT knowledge. As this tree is completely stored in a database, we call this file structure the Virtual File System, or VFS.

Using the Explorer, you can browse the VFS and check the structure of files and folders. When you click either on the icon of an entry, or do a right-click anywhere on an entry, the Context menu opens. Many options available here are also available somehow in the Page editor or Sitemap. However, some advanced options such as setting specific resource permissions are available in the Explorer only.

Go ahead and try out the Explorer. Once you are finished, come back to the tutorial and continue with the next step.
